[br /]
[br /]
[nextcol][color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Ports[/b][/size][/color]

Regular Ports: 6666, 6667, 6668, 6669
SSL Ports: 6697, 7000
[br /]
[br /]
[br /]
[br /]
[nextcol][color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Network Channels[/b][/size][/color]

#TC.Encoders [color=red][+i][/color]
#TC.Uploaders [color=red][+i][/color]
#TC.Support
#TehConnection [color=red][+i][/color]
[br /]
[br /]
[br /]
[/columns]

Upon joining the chat network for the first time, you should register your nickname with the IRC server ( /msg nickserv register <pw> <email> ). More information on registering your nick can be found by typing the following directly into your IRC client's chat bar:
[br /]
[center][b]/msg NICKSERV REGISTER HELP[/b][/center]

Alternatively see the client specific guides linked in the second paragraph for information on setting up automatic NickServ authentication.

In addition to registering your nickname, our site channels have been set to invitation only [color=red][+i][/color] which means to gain access you will need to authenticate with our bot [url=https://tehconnection.eu/peoples.php?action=person&id=278]Zooey[/url]. Client specific instructions for doing this are available in the links in the second paragraph but in general you will need to have your client send the following message to our bot:
[br /]
[center][b]/msg Zooey auth username irc_key[/b][/center]

username == Your TehConnection site username.
irc_key == The IRC key you set in your [url=https://tehconnection.eu/user.php?action=edit]profile[/url].

Your irc_key should not be the same as your site password.

Please note that Zooey will not force you to join the channels you have selected in your profile. If you authenticate with Zooey try [b]/join #TehConnection[/b].

Zooey is also able to respond to certain commands. To learn more see our article on [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=105]Zooey[/url].

fields.title: Port Forwarding
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What is port forwarding?[/size][/b][/color]

In a nutshell, port forwarding is opening a port or range of ports on a firewall to allow unsolicited external connections.

In almost all cases standard consumer routers and modems (the equipment you connect to for internet access) ship with a firewall. This firewall is generally configured to allow all outgoing connections (you requesting a web page, for example) but to drop all unsolicited incoming connections, think any computer trying to connect to you without you asking first.

This behaviour is good. It prevents people being able to attack your computer and is a nice solution to the problem of [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_background_noise]internet background noise[/url]


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Why should I forward a port?[/size][/b][/color]

Unfortunately, when it comes to the bittorrent protocol, this behaviour does not help in sharing files very well.

When you add a torrent file to your client it connects to TehConnection and retrieves a list of IP addresses which currently have the file you are after. Your PC then connects to as many of those IP addresses as it can to download the file.

If one of those addresses does not have an open port then when you try to connect the firewall will most likely drop the connection and you will not be able to download from that IP address.

Possibly worse than not being able to download from others is the frustration of not being able to seed. You may find that without an open port you may have many torrents seeding in your client but not seeding anything. This is because when others try to connect to your IP address they are rejected.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]How do I forward a port?[/size][/b][/color]

Luckily many people have asked that question before. So many, in fact, that there is a website dedicated specifically to guides on how to forward ports on almost all consumer routers. The fastest way to learn how to forward a port is to go to [url=https://portforward.com/]this website[/url] and search for your model of modem or router.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What if I still have issues?[/size][/b][/color]

The best way to get assistance is to ask your fellow TehConnection members. We all have an interest in you being able to download and upload.

First, search the forums for port forward questions, if there is nothing helpful already asked then start a new topic in the [url=https://tehconnection.eu/forums.php?action=viewforum&forumid=16]Help[/url] forum. Remember to include relevant details including the make and model of your router or modem and specifically what seems not to work.

fields.title: Warnings
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What is a Warning?[/b][/size][/color]

A warning is exactly what its name suggests. It is a message that you have failed to adhere to our site's rules and is a signal that the identified behaviour needs to stop. A warning will not prevent you doing anything on site but can be accompanied by disablement of certain site privileges depending on the severity of the offence.

When you receive a warning you will also receive a private message from the issuing staff member with an explanation of how long your warning will last and the reason you have been warned.

A user with a warning is designated by an image next to their username ([img]https://static.tehconnection.eu/common/symbols/warned.png[/img]).

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Why Would I Receive a Warning?[/b][/size][/color]

There are several reasons for which you could receive a warning. Violating the spirit of something in our [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=94]site manifesto[/url] will in most cases result in a warning at the very least. Other ways in which you can receive a warning include breaking one of the [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=88]site rules[/url], insulting or personally attacking other members of this site or making a nuisance of yourself either on site or in IRC.

Often accompanying a warning will be a restriction of certain site privileges; if you are warned for repeated upload rule violations you may find your upload privileges restricted for some time.

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]How Long Does a Warning Last?[/b][/size][/color]

Warnings can last from a single week up to eight weeks. The length of a warning will be determined by the staff member responsible for issuing it. Restriction of site privileges has no set length and is up to the particular staff members' discretion.

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What Do I Do if I Feel Unfairly Targeted?[/b][/size][/color]

If, for any reason, you feel your warning was unfair; please, in the first instance contact the staff member who issued it via private message. Explain in a calm, civil manner why you think it was unfair and/or ask for clarification. If you are still dissatisfied then join our site support channel in IRC (#TC.Support) and ask for further consideration of your case. Ultimately, however, a warning is issued and upheld by the issuing staff member.

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What Not to Do if You Receive a Warning.[/b][/size][/color]

Do not continue to do whatever it was you were warned for. Repeatedly ignoring rules and warnings will result in account disablement.

Do not under any circumstances complain in the forums or main IRC channel. This will likely only serve to lengthen your warning.

Do not contact any other staff member than the one who issued your warning. Any warnings issued are the responsibility of the issuing staff member.

fields.title: Helping Out at TehConnection
fields.body:
So you're impressed with this site and want to do something to contribute or you think pretty much everything here is done badly and needs someone to step in and fix it. Whatever your angle, here is a list of ways to contribute to the TehConnection community.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Seeding[/b][/size][/color]

The number one way to ensure a great community is a large dedicated base of seeders. Seriously, this helps more than most people realise.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Uploading[/b][/size][/color]

Second only to seeding content already on site is providing new content to the site. Make sure you read our uploading rules but uploading films can only help the site. There are many places to source films to upload. Think your local library, films from elsewhere on the internet etc...


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Encoding[/b][/size][/color]

Not so much of a dark art as it used to be; we have a very talented group of encoders on site who have contributed greatly in terms of content as well as teaching others how to encode their DVDs and Blu-ray discs. Take a look at our guides and tutorials board and the Wiki for a list of encoding tutorials and upload something that no other site has.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Donating[/b][/size][/color]

Without donations this site stops running. Literally, the server hosts unplug it. If you have a few dollars spare during the month consider donating to keep this community running. To read more about donating click [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=81]here[/url] or the [b]Donate![/b] link at the top of any page.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]The Studio[/b][/size][/color]

The Studio is a forum board specifically dedicated to users contributing code, scripts, and style sheets. If you have some coding nous or want to show off a site enhancement you devised check in there.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Help (forum & IRC)[/b][/size][/color]

Having members provide knowledge on pretty much anything is what really makes this place a community. Take a peek in our help board on the forums or idling in IRC and answering questions is a great assistance to the site. Likewise, feel free to ask questions on anything you might not understand but make sure to search the forum first.

fields.title: How to Get Help/Can't Find What You're Looking For
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What Should I Do if I Can't Find An Answer to What I Am Looking For?[/b][/size][/color]

The first places you should check for answers are our [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=88]site rules[/url] and our [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php]site wiki[/url].

If both of those resources do not answer your question take a look at our forums. Chances are, someone has also had a similar question. Make sure to search them first but don't be afraid to ask a question. Also join our [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=104]IRC network[/url] for real time assistance.

Please use common sense, for any account related questions please send a message a [url=https://tehconnection.eu/staffpm.php?action=new]staff member[/url]. Avoid posting your passkey or e-mail address in public spaces on site or IRC.

fields.title: How to Start a New Thread
fields.body:
So you would like to post in our forums, eh? First thing you need to know is how to start a new thread.

As soon as you have picked the board you wish to post in click the 'Forum Menu' drop down.
[br /]
[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/N69bL.png[/img][/center]

From there click New Topic. Enter a Title for your thread and whatever your first post will contain. Remember you have the [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=24]BBCode[/url] and [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=38]Emoticons[/url] at your disposal.

Please make sure you post threads in the most appropriate board and if you're asking for help remember to search first. It is likely that someone has had the same issue you have.

fields.title: Custom Titles
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What Is a Custom Title?[/b][/size][/color]

A custom title is a line of text and/or images that appears next to a member's site nick.
[br /]
[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/H1Q5I.png[/img][/center]


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]How Do I Get a Custom Title?[/b][/size][/color]

Custom titles are given out by staff purely at their discretion. They are sometimes used as prizes in competitions and often as a way to reward users who have done something for the site, such as donating.

Custom titles can also be edited manually as a privilege by reaching Teh Producer user class. For more information on user classes click [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=2]here[/url].

Begging a staffer for a custom title will often result in a warning or even a title that you don't want :O

fields.title: How to Reply in An Existing Thread
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Reply in An Existing Forum Thread[/b][/size][/color]

Replying to a forum thread is a fairly straight forward process. At the end of every page in any unlocked thread is a text box.
[br /]
[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/ZKKtm.png[/img][/center]

You are able to enter a reply in this box and make use of any of the [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=38]emoticons[/url] or [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=24]BBCode[/url] available on site.

If you'd like to preview your post before you post it you can do so with the 'Preview' button. After clicking preview you'll see your post as it will appear on site. If you're happy you can click 'Submit' or click 'Editor' to keep editing.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What If I Want to Change What I Have Written?[/b][/size][/color]

We have a built in edit function to assist you in editing your forum posts. Simply click the '[Edit]' link on the top of any of your posts and you'll be able to change what you have written.

Please note that any edits made by staff to your posts must not be removed by you. Doing so can result in warnings.

Also note that it is forum etiquette to avoid double posting - posting twice in a row. Please edit your last post.

fields.title: How to Quote
fields.body:
Quoting is an important part of using the forums. Providing an accurate quote when replying to someone who commented a while ago can save major confusion to other members.

Quoting is done easily on TehConnection. Simply click the 'Quote' link on top of any post to quote the entire post.

You are able to edit any part of the quote to remove unnecessary text if it is unrelated to your reply. This is often helpful when you want to make a specific point.

There is some etiquette to quoting in the forums. Firstly make sure you only post accurate quotes. Secondly try to avoid quote trains. A quote train is a series of posts quoting all of the last. These can end up becoming massive beasts and nearly impossible to follow.

fields.title: Seeder Surge
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What is Seeder Surge?[/b][/size][/color]

Seeder Surge is an initiative aimed at encouraging long term retention of torrents. All torrents older than 4 weeks, with fewer than five ([b]5[/b]) seeders, are automatically [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=17]freeleech[/url]. The catch is that as soon as any torrent reaches five ([b]5[/b]) seeds, its freeleech status is revoked and anyone still downloading will have their ratio updated accordingly.

All torrents currently qualifying for freeleech under Seeder Surge status are marked as follows:
[br /]
[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/THQGa.png[/img][/center]

This feature is dynamic and automatic so, if you are watching your ratio, be mindful that torrents marked [i]Seeder Surge[/i] might still change your ratio, if they reach five ([b]5[/b]) seeders before you finish downloading.

fields.title: How to Request a Torrent
fields.body:
[i][url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php]Wiki Home[/url][/i]


TehConnection has a comprehensive request system in place which allows you to request pretty much any permitted film in any allowed format. This is a quick tutorial to guide members who are new to the requests system.

First of all you will need to head to the request page. This can be achieved in one of two ways.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]1.[/b][/size][/color]
[indent]Either click on 'requests' in the top set of buttons on site.[/indent]

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/uHhyM.png[/img][/center]


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]2.[/b][/size][/color]
[indent]Alternatively you can click the 'Torrent' menu on any film page. At the bottom of this menu is a 'Request Format' option. This is useful if you know a version of the film is on site already as it skips some of the steps in the request process.

Choosing the second option will land you directly on a new request page. You can skip down to step five.[/indent]

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/hXjZA.png[/img][/center]

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]3.[/b][/size][/color]
[indent]Clicking the 'requests' button will take you to the main request page. From here you need to click the '[New Request]' link.[/indent]

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]4.[/b][/size][/color]
[indent]Your next step is to open a new tab/page and head to https://imdb.com/ and search for the film you are after. Once on the film page on IMDb copy the page URL, paste it into the IMDb text box and click 'Fetch from IMDb'. This will populate the fields we need from IMDb.[/indent]

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]5.[/b][/size][/color]
[indent]Now select from the four drop down boxes what format of the film you would like uploaded. Your options are explained in our TehConnection Movie Formats article.[/indent]

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]6.[/b][/size][/color]
[indent]After selecting which format you would like to have uploaded you can optionally enter a bounty as reward for the uploader who is able to successfully fill your request.

Every request incurs a minimum bounty of two hundred fifty ([b]250[/b]) MiB from the requester's upload statistics. This can bee seen from your site profile as the amount of ratio spent on requests.[/indent]

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/J7OPD.png[/img][/center]

[indent][b]Note[/b]: When calculating a custom bounty to add to a request; make sure to keep in mind that 1 GiB is 1024 MiB. This can be confusing if you were to enter 1000 MB thinking it to be equal to a GiB. This is a common confusion (more detailed information on [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binary_prefix]Wikipedia[/url]) and has been avoided by our inclusion of a MB/GB check box.

50% of each bounty is taken by the site as a form of 'tax', this is to make sure there is some balance to the site economy. The tax is taken and cannot be refunded at all so be careful.[/indent]

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]7.[/b][/size][/color]
[indent]Last but not least we have the description text box. This can be a very important field depending on what you are after.

Common examples of information in this field include:
[list=circle]
[*]A specific Scene release of a film, put the Scene release name in that box.
[*]A specific company's release of a DVD (such as Criterion or Tartan).
[*]A link to where it is possible to buy the movie.
[/list]

Anything (within reason) that you require that hasn't already been specified can be put into this field.[/indent]

fields.title: How to Fill a Request
fields.body:
To properly fill a request, first be sure that your fill meets [b]ALL[/b] the requirements spelled out in the original request - including information contained in the 'Comments' section of the request. Oftentimes the request will specify a format, a medium, or some other defining value which makes the request special, rare, or otherwise differentiated.

Once you've confirmed your fill meets the requirements, upload the torrent to the site (if it's not up already).

To fill the request copy the direct link to the individual torrent which fills the request. You can get this link from a few places:

[list=circle]
[*] The address bar of your web browser right after you upload the torrent.
[*] Copying the [b][PL][/b] link of the torrent you have uploaded.
[/list]

Paste it into the "Fill Request" box located within the request itself. Check for spaces both before and after the link as these will break the form.

fields.title: How to Unfill a Request
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What Can I Do If Someone Has Filled My Request Incorrectly?[/b][/size][/color]

If you discover that a request you have made has been filled incorrectly. You are able to unfill the request from the particular request page.

On the 'Filled' line will be a link 'Unfill'; simply click this to immediately unfill the request. It is a good idea to PM the request filler and let them know why you have unfilled the request.

Do not abuse the unfill button. Abuse will result in loss of request privileges.

fields.title: How to Upload an Untouched DVDR (AnyDVD)
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]AnyDVD[/b][/size][/color] - [url=https://www.slysoft.com/]https://www.slysoft.com/[/url]

[b]Note[/b]: This guide assumes that you have AnyDVD installed and working on your PC. If you need to find AnyDVD, download from their [url=https://www.slysoft.com/]site[/url] or look for it on your favorite apps tracker. Also, you must use the original retail DVD when you follow this guide for it to be an untouched copy!


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]1.[/b][/size][/color]
[indent]Open AnyDVD and insert the DVD into your optical drive. AnyDVD should open to the system tray, and you should see an icon like this:[/indent][br /]

[center][img]https://img19.imageshack.us/img19/7105/80741236.png[/img][/center]


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]2.[/b][/size][/color]
[indent]Right click on that icon, and select "Rip Video DVD to Hardisk".[/indent][br /]

[center][img]https://img24.imageshack.us/img24/1332/54260571.png[/img][/center]

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]3.[/b][/size][/color]
[indent]A box will pop up called "AnyDVD Ripper".[/indent][br /]

[center][img]https://img687.imageshack.us/img687/5337/80967898.png[/img][/center]


[indent]Here you can select the DVD Drive you are ripping from (it should default to the proper drive). If not, change it to the drive that the DVD is in. Next choose the destination folder that you want to save the DVD to, and click "Copy DVD". AnyDVD will now rip the DVD to the folder you specified.[/indent]

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]4.[/b][/size][/color]
[indent]Once AnyDVD has completed the ripping process, go to the destination folder. It should look something like this:[/indent][br /]

[center][img]https://img693.imageshack.us/img693/1169/57489720.png[/img][/center]


[indent]The DVD should be contained in a folder which is named after the movie. For example, the path to your ripped DVD should look like this: "C:\Movie_Title_Here\VIDEO_TS". "VIDEO_TS" is the folder that is seen in the screenshot above. It contains all the files that you ripped.

That VIDEO_TS folder should be inside a folder which is named after the movie. When you go to make the .torrent you want to select the "Movie_Title_Here" directory so the completed torrent should be named: "Movie_Title_Here.torrent".[/indent]

fields.title: How to Upload an Untouched DVDR (dvdbackup)
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]dvdbackup[/b][/size][/color] - [url=https://dvdbackup.sourceforge.net/]https://dvdbackup.sourceforge.net/[/url]

This guide is based on a Debian Linux system, but the concepts apply to all other Linux systems as well.

First you must ensure DVD decoding software is installed (if you are able to watch a DVD, it is). On Debian, the package is called 'libdvdcss'. you can get the package via adding the VideoLAN repository to your 'sources.conf' file. 


The quick guide for adding the VideoLAN repository and installing libdvdcss on Debian:
[list=1]
[*] Go to [url=https://www.videolan.org/developers/libdvdcss.html]https://www.videolan.org/developers/libdvdcss.html[/url] and follow the instructions under 'Get libdvdcss'.

[*] Update the package manager:

[pre]aptitude update[/pre]
[*] Install libdvdcss:

[pre]aptitude install libdvdcss[/pre]
[/list]

Now that the decoding library is installed, continue with installing dvdbackup.

[pre]aptitude install dvdbackup[/pre]
If everything went fine, you can rip your DVD now by running:

[pre]dvdbackup -M -o ~/Movie_Name[/pre]
where 'Movie_Name' will be the folder in which the ripped DVD will be saved. dvdbackup assumes your DVD device is '/dev/dvd', so if it isn't, use the parameter '-i /path/to/dvd_device' instead.

If you have installed everything and have problems with ripping, please consult "man dvdbackup" or refer to [url=https://manpages.debian.org/cgi-bin/man.cgi]https://manpages.debian.org/cgi-bin/man.cgi[/url].

fields.title: Advanced Search
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What is the Advanced Search?[/b][/size][/color]

The [url=https://tehconnection.eu/torrents.php?action=advanced]Advanced Search[/url] feature gives you much greater control over search functionality on site.

In addition to the basic keyword search the advanced search allows you to search:
[list=circle]
[*] By 'Year' of film release. This is as listed by IMDb, not the year it arrives in your local cinema.
[*] 'Exact Phrase' is useful for films with a similar name or for films with fewer than two characters in their title as the site will not allow you to search fewer than two characters.
[*] 'File Details' allows you to specify additional restrictions such as CODEC (Xvid, x264 etc...), resolution (SD, 720p etc...) and source media (DVD, Blu-ray, HDTV etc...)
[/list]

These are in addition to the regular keyword and genre/tag search available.

fields.title: CODECs & Containers Explained
fields.body:
There can often be some confusion when one is new to downloading video and encounters terms such as CODEC, x264, Matroska or container. This article aims to explain all of those terms and remove any confusion.

Firstly, we need a place to start. When talking about digital video files there are two main components that are important to understand. The [i]CODEC[/i] used in the file and the files [i]container[/i]. An easy way to think about the differences between these components is to imagine a video file as a sandwich. The CODEC is the filling and the container is the bread.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What is a CODEC?[/b][/size][/color]

CODEC is a portmanteau of 'compressor-decompressor', in this sense it refers to what software was used to compress the original video stream into what it is now as well as what software can be used to decompress the file's data and allow playback. More precisely, a CODEC is a mathematical algorithm used to compress digital audio and video for transmission and decompress it for playback.

The most common CODECs you will encounter on TehConnection are Xvid and x264. A full list of CODECs allowed is available below and includes explanations.

[b]DivX[/b] - DivX, in its earliest form, originated from a reverse engineered version of the Microsoft MPEG-4 Version 3 video CODEC. Later, it was substantially re-written and improved. After a falling out between the original developers the project was forked and Xvid was born.

[b]Xvid[/b] - Xvid (formerly XviD) is the most common CODEC in use today with regard to file sharing. It is open source and highly efficient when used to compress video streams for transport over the internet.

[b]x264[/b] - x264 is a free and open source implementation of the MPEG-4 AVC/H.264 standard which is the current standard used in Blu-ray disc authoring. This CODEC is highly efficient and is the best choice for encoding standard and high definition content when considering quality.

[b]MPEG-2[/b] - MPEG-2 is the standard and encoder introduced before MPEG-4 and is used in DVDs and a lot of HDTV broadcasts.

 [indent]- TS: Stands for Transport Stream and is the format designed for television broadcast.
 - PS: Stands for Program Stream and is the standard designed for storage of digital media such as DVDs.[/indent]

[b]VC-1[/b] - VC-1 is Microsoft's newest video CODEC and has been adopted as a standard for Blu-ray discs.

[b]AVC[/b] - AVC is the other standard adopted as a Blu-ray disc format. It is the official offering of the MPEG & ITU groups.


It is also important to make a distinction here between CODECs and standards. A CODEC is a piece of software that is used to compress or decompress a video stream. A standard is a set of (usually) industry accepted guidelines on what a CODEC must do. A good analogy is imagining a standard as a basic blueprint and a CODEC is the actual building the blueprint describes.

There are often misunderstandings relating to the H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video standards and the x264 CODEC. Often you will see people label a file with 'h.264' and while that is not strictly incorrect; it is much more useful to label it with which CODEC was used during encoding and is what we do at TehConnection.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What is a Container?[/b][/size][/color]

A container, as mentioned above, can be imagined as the bread part of a sandwich. It is what takes the interesting stuff and keeps it together an a (mostly, depending on your eating ability) manageable format.

The container will often determine the file extension of a particular video file. For example, a file wrapped in the Audio/Video interleave container will have the .avi extension. The two most common containers you will encounter on TehConnection are Matroska and Audio/Video Interleave.

Matroska is a new, open source, container format with the file extension .mkv. This new container is under active development and supports many new features. As such, it is the container format used for high definition media as well as higher quality standard definition content.


Audio/Video Interleave, best known as AVI because of its file extension (.avi). This format was devloped by Microsoft in 1992. Because of its age there are many features and requirements of newer CODECs that it is unable to fill and as such is only permitted to contain MPEG-4 ASP (Xvid/DivX) at TehConnection.

DVDR (PAL/NTSC) (MPEG-2) This container is a proprietary format adapted from the MPEG-2 standard. It is specifically designed to contain DVD compliant data and as such any video stream that does not conform to the requirements cannot be compressed.

Ogg

Blu-ray

HD-DVD

TS (MPEG-2)

fields.title: GNU/Linux Multimedia Playback Guide
fields.body:
The GNU/Linux platform features a number of different playback and recording systems. A functional GNU/Linux setup usually includes several of these systems, which function at different layers, typically in coexistence. This article intends to outline those systems, helping the end-user to tame the [url=https://www.trilug.org/~crimsun/linuxaudio.png]notoriously complex[/url] Linux sound system, and take full advantage of the powerful multimedia decoding options available on the platform.

Table of Contents:[list]
[*]1 Audio Output[list]
[*]1.1 Audio with ALSA
[*]1.2 Audio with OSS
[*]1.3 Advanced Audio with PulseAudio[/list]
[*]2 Video Output[list]
[*]2.1 Accelerated Video with Nvidia
[*]2.2 Accelerated Video with ATI
[*]2.3 Accelerated Video with Intel
[*]2.4 Fallback: Software-Accelerated Video[/list]
[*]3 Multimedia Codecs & Applications[list]
[*]3.1 GStreamer
[*]3.2 Xine
[*]3.3 FFMPEG
[*]3.4 VLC
[*]3.5 Phonon[/list]
[*]4 TODO [/list]

fields.title: Burn DVDR to DVD With Toast (Mac OS X)
fields.body:
[url=https://www.roxio.com/enu/products/toast/]Toast[/url] is the easiest and fastest way to burn your movies to DVD on Mac OS X. Here is a step by step guide on how to burn a DVDR on to a blank DVD for playback on DVD players:


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Burning From an Image File (.iso, .img)[/b][/size][/color]
[br /]
[list=circle]
[*]Open Toast.
[*]On the tabs located on the upper left hand side, click Copy.
[*]Under this tab are 3 options: Disc Copy, Image file, Disc Image Merge. Choose “Image File.”
[*]Click “Select…” and locate the DVDR image file on the folder in which it is saved.
[*]Once the DVDR image is loaded, click the bright red button to start burning.
[*]If a blank DVD is already loaded, it will start burning the disc. If not, user will be prompted to insert one.
[/list]


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Burning From a VIDEO_TS Folder[/b][/size][/color]
[br /]
[list=circle]
[*]Open Toast Titanium.
[*]On the tabs located on the upper left hand side, click Video.
[*]Under this tab, select “VIDEO_TS Folders.”
[*]On the bottom is an “Add” button. Click it and locate the movie you would like to burn on the blank DVD.
[*]Once you locate the VIDEO_TS folder, select it and click “Choose.”
[*]Click the bright red button to start burning. If a blank DVD is already loaded, it will start burning the disc. If not, user will be prompted to insert one.

fields.title: Request Etiquette
fields.body:
There are certain matters of etiquette that should be taken in to account with respect to requests.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Request Etiquette[/b][/size][/color]

1. Before making a request, double check whether what you are after is already on the site and/or if a request already exists.

2. You should put in any details about the request (e.g. CODEC) when you submit it, or explicitly state that you don't mind about any particular criterion. This will mean that your request will be filled to your satisfaction.

3. You should not post your request to the forums or on IRC, asking people either to add bounty or to fill the request. Simply making the request will suffice.

4. You should try to give as much information as possible about the request, as that will help potential fillers or co-requesters.

5. You should not unfill a request if it meets the criteria stated, even if you forgot to state some when you originally posted the request. If it is what you said you wanted but not what you actually wanted, too bad. Learn for next time.

6. You should not use the request system as a way to transfer upload credit to another member of the site.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Filling a Request[/b][/size][/color]

1. If you see a request for which a torrent is already on the site, it is considered good courtesy to notify the uploader of that torrent, rather than filling the request and claiming the bounty yourself. If the uploader then does not respond after a suitable period of time, feel free to fill it.

2. You should not ask for extra bounty before you fill a request. Bounty is not a right, it is a gift.

3. You should not fill a request with a torrent that does not meet the stated criteria. If you are unsure about whether your torrent meets the stated criteria, contact either the person who made the request or a member of [url=https://tehconnection.eu/staff.php]staff[/url].

fields.title: How to Generate Screenshots With FFmpeg (Linux)
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What You Will Need[/b][/size][/color]
[br /]
[list]
[*]ffmpeg [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=206](Install guide)[/url]
[*]macguffin [url=https://github.com/hwkns/macguffin](Follow installation instructions here)[/url]
[/list]

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Setting up Macguffin[/b][/size][/color]

Macguffin has the ability to upload the screenshots it generates to imgbam.com for you. But in order for this to work you will need to [url=https://www.imagebam.com/register]make an account on imagebam[/url] and then edit config.py with your imgbam login details. Alternatively if you don't want the screenshots to be uploaded automatically you can skip this step.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Using Macguffin[/b][/size][/color]

At this stage taking screenshots should be pretty easy. All you need to do is:
[list]
[*]/path/to/macguffin/screens.py /path/to/video.file.mkv
[/list]

If you don't want the screenshots uploaded to imgbam you can run
[list]
[*]/path/to/macguffin/screens.py -U /path/to/video.file.mkv
[/list]


[i]Alternatively, you can use b3n's Screenshot script on the Linux command line:[/i]

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]b3n's Screenshot Script[/b][/size][/color]

This script will extract a screenshot every 20 mins as many times as you specify. Save the text below as screenshot.sh then run these commands to take four shots from THE.FILE.avi
[br /]
[list]
[*]chmod +x screenshot.sh
[*]./screenshot.sh THE.FILE.avi 4
[/list]

[quote]
[size=2][pre]
#!/bin/bash
file=$1
times=$2
x=1
while [ $x -le $times ];
do
ffmpeg -ss $(echo "$x * 1200" | bc -l) -i "$file" -an -vframes 1 -f image2 images$(echo "$x").png;
x=$(( $x + 1 ))
done
[/pre][/size]
[/quote]

fields.title: What is a Seedbox?
fields.body:
A seedbox is usually defined as a remote computer and usually attached to a high speed internet connection and used to seed torrents. These computers can be shared or private and can range from 10Mbit/s to 10Gbit/s connections. If you're considering a seedbox, consult our official [url=https://tehconnection.eu/forums.php?action=viewthread&threadid=4599]seedbox recommendation thread[/url] for advice on providers.

Generally there are three "types" of seedbox available.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Dedicated Server[/b][/size][/color]

This is a dedicated physical machine that is rented from a provider or reseller. As the machine is dedicated it is usually an 'assembly required' option as the user will have to configure the operating system, install the torrent client and any other required software. However, as the user has full control of the physical hardware, it can be used to the full potential. Windows based servers usually cost more due to the cost of the Microsoft license. 

When buying a dedicated server the physical hardware specifications should be considered, specifically RAM size, hard drive size and CPU speed.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]VPS[/b][/size][/color]

A VPS is a Virtual Private Server and is a dedicated server that has been split virtually for clients. Like dedicated servers these virtual servers are rented out to clients. Also like a dedicated server configuration of the operating system will be necessary unless the provider supplies a pre-configured environment.

When buying a VPS server the ammount of RAM allocated to your VPS should be considered. The burstable CPU speed also needs to be taken into account. [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virtual_private_server]More information about VPS's[/url]


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Slice/Shared[/b][/size][/color]

This is becoming the most popular way to have access to a seedbox. A slice is generally just access to a torrent client running on server. Providers may allow access to a control panel or FTP access. But generally the client will have no other control of the server. This is preferred as no configuration is required.

For all types of seedbox, the three main metrics to be considered are:

[list]
[*]Hard drive space (How many files you can store)
[*]Network speed (How fast you can download/upload)
[*]Bandwidth limits (How much data you can download/upload)
[/list]

In addition to these metrics you should also consider the cost, support offered and, if you desire files from your seedbox at home, location and/or routing. Routing is important to ensure fast FTP/SFTP download speed.

fields.title: How to Find a Movie to Watch
fields.body:
When you don't have a movie in mind that you'd like to watch it can be extremely hard to select one. Luckily, there are several options to assist you in selecting a movie. Every movie page on TehConnection features a trailer, list of cast, as well as rating from various online critic sources.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Using TehConnection[/b][/size][/color]


[size=5][b][url=https://tehconnection.eu/top10.php]Top 10[/url][/b][/size]

The Top 10 page will allow you to view the Top 10 most active torrents within the passed day, week, and of all time. This is a great way to find popular movies that you may not have seen. From this same page you can also expand to view the top 100 or the 250.


[size=5][b][url=https://tehconnection.eu/torrents.php]Films[/url][/b][/size]

The Films page contains various filters that enable you to sort the entire list of torrents on site. Click the up arrow image above the torrent listings to sort all torrents by the number of seeders. Another great way to find a popular movie that may be relevant to your current taste (action, comedy, etc...) is to simply click one or more of the genre icons and click the up arrow again to refresh the top seeded torrents. You can narrow down the genre even more by selecting one of the sub-genre options (indie, musical, etc...). Sorting by year, title, and IMDb ratin are all possible from the Films page too.


[size=5][b][url=https://tehconnection.eu/peoples.php]Peoples[/url][/b][/size]

This is, by far, the most underutilised tool within TehConnection for finding a movie that you may enjoy!
[br /]
[indent]
[i]"The "Peoples" feature is something we've concocted here at TehConnection to help you get connected to the movies here on the site. We're all movie fans and one thing we can all recognize is wanting to discover new and awesome movies. We've all got favourite actors, directors and writers. Whether you're a Whedon-ite and want to see everything Joss Whedon's ever worked on, or if you're a fan of thrillers and want to see all the Hitchcock films, you'll enjoy the Peoples section.

We've all spent time wandering through imdb listings and looking at all the cool movies we could find, often cross-referencing with our favourite tracker and hoping to find an awesome movie to watch. So, we sat down and thought about it and decided that we could do that here, so we grab the cast, directors and writers from IMDb and create listings here. If you're a fan of Robin Williams, you'll want to see all his movies, so check out his Peoples page and see what you haven't already seen and get to watching."[/i]
[/indent]


[size=5][b][url=https://tehconnection.eu/montage.php]Montages[/url][/b][/size]

Montages are user created lists of movies that are related to a certain subject, genre, or series. On a montage page, all the movies listed in the montage will be listed in a grid with their corresponding cover art. This is a great way to find a movie that you may have enjoyed years back, or you can simply click a random one and read the description or watch the trailer. A great example of a montage is "IMDb -- Top 50 Comedy Titles". The 50 highest rated movies on IMDb have been aggregated into this list. There are many other montages other than Top 50/100/250. Some montages are created to list the top award winning films, and some are simply to list films that are relevant to a certain category (e.g. Documentary).


[size=5][b][url=https://tehconnection.eu/reviews.php]Reviews[/url][/b][/size]

On the reviews page, you will find user-generated reviews on many movies. You can either search for a movie you may have in mind, or search through the list for a movie that may have received many good reviews, or many bad reviews.


[size=5][b][url=https://tehconnection.eu/torrents.php?action=random]Random Torrent[/url][/b][/size]

An unlisted feature on TehConnection, but a standard part of Gazelle, random torrent is a useful tool for finding movies that you may not have seen and movies that may open your eyes and mind to new genres and styles of movies. You might find it handy to bookmark the following link:

[ https://tehconnection.eu/torrents.php?action=random ]

You can now refresh this page, and each time you refresh TehConnection will return a random movie listing for you.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Outside of TehConnection[/b][/size][/color]


[size=5][b][url=https://suggestmeagoodmovie.com/]Suggest Me a Good Movie[/url][/b][/size]

Member [url=https://tehconnection.eu/user.php?id=32311]assfaster[/url] has devloped an interesting website dedicate to making finding a film to watch simpler. Of course, if you find his site useful feel free to send him a message and suggest improvements or new features you'd like to see.


[size=5][b][url=https://www.imdb.com/]Internet Movie Database (IMDb)[/url][/b][/size]

IMDb is an database of all information relating to movies, television, cast, video games, and fictional characters featured in visual entertainment media. IMDb is the most popular movie database on the internet. You can find information on nearly every movie in existence on this website.


[size=5][b][url=https://www.tastekid.com/]TasteKid[/url][/b][/size]

TasteKid is a search engine that allows you to input a movie or actor that you have seen, and will find other movies that are similar or have that actor in them.


[size=5][b][url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/]Rotten Tomatoes[/url][/b][/size]

Rotten Tomatoes is one of the top review websites for film and television. A useful link to bookmark is their recently released DVD section. [url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/dvd/]https://www.rottentomatoes.com/dvd/[/url].


[size=5][b]Forums, Blogs, Chat, Word of Mouth[/b][/size]

Talking to other people about movies can be the most simple way of finding a movie to watch. If you're absolutely stuck on finding a movie, just ask! No matter where you are, people watch movies and almost always have something to say about them. Simply asking a friend "Hey, what's a good movie to watch?" can lead you to all sorts of new types of movies. Even asking on your favourite social networking website is bound to get some answer and maybe spark some debate. TehConnection's [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=104]IRC[/url] is especially good at helping out with movie selection.

fields.title: Port Forwarding A Beginner's Guide
fields.body:
[b]I (Elwood) did not write most of this.[/b]

So you've just learned how BitTorrent works but then after all your hard research you download stuff, wait to upload, and what? Nothing's uploading? Chances are, if you are behind a router, you need to do some portfwarding. This is what happens when on the torrent pages, you are listed as “Not Connectable”

[b]
1.How Routers Work
2.Internal vs External IPs
3.Static vs Dynamic IPs
4.How Ports Work
5.Putting it All together
6.Now What?

[/b]
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]How Routers Work[/b][/size][/color]

Before we can get into all that good junk, I think it's best to explain just how routers work.

Let's say you have multiple PCs under one roof...rather than have a modem for every single PC to connect to the internet, you have one modem, and one router. With the router every PC in the house can connect to the internet, using a wireless connection.

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Internal vs External IPs[/b][/size][/color]

The router has what's called an external IP address that “marks” who you are. You, me, and everyone that's connected to the internet has an external IP – when you go to Google and do the “What's my IP?” thing – that's your external.

However, only one IP address is assigned for one household (unless you pay for it assuming your ISP offers...unlikely), so what happens when 3 different PCs are under one router? Well, they all have the same external address, but each individual PC has an internal IP address.

The internal IP address identifies each computer on the network. It's normally something like 192.xxx.x.xxx. For example, my internal IP address last time I checked was 192.168.1.3. Don't worry, nobody can see your internal address unless they're on the same network as you.

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Static vs Dynamic IPs[/b][/size][/color]

Don't worry, we're getting to the good stuff soon. But you need to know this info in order to understand how port forwarding works. This is pretty easy though.

A dynamic IP address will change, most of the time randomly. This could apply to external or internal IPs, but for port forwarding you have to pay attention to the internal IP address. When does it change? It depends. Sometimes it'll change every time you reconnect, sometimes if you get rebooted...it just depends on the router.

A static IP address never changes; you set it to a specific IP and it stays there until the router is either set back to factory defaults or you change it.

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]How Ports Work[/b][/size][/color]

When a packet is sent to a computer – when information is sent to a computer that is – it travels through an open port. Your PC does this all the time without you even knowing! Common ports are used daily, for things like the internet, instant messaging, etc.

For example, it might be that your instant message client uses port 5555, and your IP is 987.654.321. When you are sending a message, the data is sent from 987.654.321:5555. The : designates the port number to be used.

But the rest of the ports on your connection are closed, unless you open them. This is all leading up to our next section...

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]But what IS port forwarding?[/b][/size][/color] 

Why do I care? What does this have to do with my slow uploads!?

When you don't have a port open for your BitTorrent client, it makes connecting to people extremely difficult. When your ports are not forwarded, you can send a request to connect to a peer, but you can't receive any.

What?

Ok, let's say Bob, Sally, and Joe are all on a torrent. Bob is the only one that is connectable (ports forwarded). Sally sends a request to connect to Bob, which he can accept and they're fine. Joe does the same. However, Joe then sends a request to connect to Sally, but guess what? They aren't going to connect. Why? Because Sally can't receive any incoming connections.

Now imagine if all three weren't connectable. Nobody would connect! People would be sending requests left and right, but nothing.

So if you've noticed lately that you aren't connecting to any leechers (or seeders), and there are a LOT OF BOTH, then you need to do some port forwarding. Opening your ports will also greatly help your upload /download speed itself.

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]So how do I do that?[/b][/size][/color]

Well first you need to set up a static internal IP, what we were talking about earlier. Why is this? Because in order to forward your ports you have to assign a “rule” in your router settings to keep that port open. You assign the rule based on the internal IP – that way the router knows which PC it's talking about.

Have you seen the problem yet? If you have a dynamic static IP, every time your dynamic IP changes you have to go into your router settings and change it. Again. Sounds annoying, doesn't it? But if you make your IP static, all will be resolved

A link to making your IP static can be found here (yes, for Macs too and even xbox 360): https://www.portforward.com/networking/staticip.htm

Those directions are real easy, just follow them and you'll be good.

[size=3][b]When you first set up your static IP, you WILL lose connection briefly. It's your router resetting itself. You SHOULD reconnect just fine in a bit...you only have problems if you won't reconnect at all.[/b][/size]

Once you've set up your static IP you need to pick a port to open up for your torrent client.
Check out the port authority (so to speak), IANA.org, and choose an unassigned port from 1 to 49151, or any port from 49152 to 65535.
Assign your chosen port in your torrent client settings, and then assign a rule in your router for that port (for TCP and for UDP) for your static IP.

Don't panic! I know that was no help. Portfoward.com has literally a guide for almost any router you can think of. Just go to https://www.portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/routerindex.htm , find your router, and then find your client in the list that pops up. 99% of the time those guides are very straight forward and simple.

Firewall software, if you run it (either built-in to your OS, stand-alone 3rd party software, or included with your anti-virus) is very similar to what a router does. You'll need to go to your firewall settings and either open your chosen port (TCP and UDP), or simply set it to "allow" your torrent client to receive and send data/connections (this will let your client choose which port to open).

A guide to several software firewalls (including XP's Windows Firewall) can be found here:
https://portforward.com/english/routers/firewalling/routerindex.htm

For Mac:

OSX 10.4 (Tiger)
# Open System Prefs > Sharing > Firewall.
# Click "New."
# In the "Port Name" pop-up menu, select Other, and fill in the settings as follows:
* TCP Port Number(s): the port you chose.
* Description: Transmission (or whatever your client name is)

OSX 10.5 (Leopard)
# Open System Prefs > Security > Firewall. Make sure "Set access for specific services and applications" is selected.
# Click the "Advanced" button and select your torrent client from you Applications folder.
# Make sure the pull down menu is set to "Allow incoming connections".

OSX 10.6 (Snow Leopard)
# Open System Prefs > Security > Firewall tab
# Assuming that your firewall is running, click on "Advanced..."
# Click on the "+" symbol beneath the list of applications and select your torrent client from the Applications folder. Make sure it is set to "Allow Incoming connections"

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Once that's done...[/b][/size][/color]

You're done! Restart your client and you should be good! If you're not sure if it's working, go look at the peer list on one of the torrents you might be seeding/leeching – it will have “Yes” or “No” under connectable.

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]The Most Common Reasons for the Port Forwarding Not Working:[/b][/size][/color]

1. No static IP
2. Typo in the router settings
3. Typo in the client settings
4. Firewall not given permission
5. Port scanner/checker website (including µTorrent's built-in checker) blocked by IP blocker (like Peer Block). This may falsely advise your port is not open just because that particular IP of that checker could not connect. Try several other port checker websites to verify.

fields.title: How to Connect to TehConnection's IRC Network (irssi)
fields.body:
[i]Many thanks to b3n for this guide.[/i]


To connect to more than #TehConnection you will need an IRC client, [url=https://irssi.org/]irssi[/url] is a good multi-platform solution.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Installing irssi & Screen[/b][/size][/color]

Install both irssi & Screen if they are not already. This guide assumes you are installing then within a Debian system; for other systems change the commands to ones appropriate for your package management software.
[br /]
[indent][pre]sudo aptitude install screen irssi

screen -S irc irssi[/pre][/indent]

This will start a screen session running irssi. If you don't know about anything about screen [url=https://quadpoint.org/articles/irssi]this[/url] is a good tutorial.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Configuring irssi[/b][/size][/color]

Type the following commands into irssi. Replace [nick] with your nickname, [email] with your email, [yourpass] with a password and [IRC key] with the key found in your [url=https://tehconnection.eu/user.php?action=edit]profile[/url]. 
[br /]
[indent][pre]
/set nick [nick]
/set alternate_nick [othernick]
/set user_name [nick]
/set real_name [nick]
/set use_ssl on
/network add -nick [nick] TehConnection
/server add -auto -ssl -network TehConnection irc.tehconnection.eu 6697
/connect TehConnection
/msg nickserv register [yourpass] [email]
/msg Zooey auth [TC username] [IRC key]
/channel add -auto #tehconnection
/network add -autosendcmd "/msg nickserv identify [yourpass]" TehConnection
/network add -autosendcmd "/msg Zooey auth [TC username] [IRC key]" TehConnection[/pre][/indent]

This will add a network for TehConnection and automatically connect to the server with SSL encryption enabled. It will also automatically identify you with both nickserv and Zooey. [url=https://irssi.org/beginner/]This[/url] is a good reference for available irssi commands.

irssi also has a number of [url=https://scripts.irssi.org/]scripts[/url] that can extend or enhance functionality.

For detailed IRC Network Information and channels available see [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=104]here[/url].



[i]Many thanks to b3n for this guide.[/i]

fields.title: How To: Reseed a torrent [rTorrent]
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]How Do I Reseed a Torrent With rTorrent?[/b][/size][/color]


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]1.[/b][/size][/color] Download the .torrent file you want to reseed or note the url location.

[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]2.[/b][/size][/color] Note the location of the local files you want to seed.

Assuming your rTorrent instance is running under screen, SSH into your server and re-attach your screen session with "[b]screen -r[/b]". Once inside rTorrent hit ([b]enter[/b]) to load a .torrent either from file location or a URL.

This will load the torrent file in a stopped state. Now press ([b]4[/b]) to show only stopped torrents. Use the arrow keys to navigate to the stopped torrent and press "([b]Ctrl[/b]) + ([b]O[/b])" to set the download location to the path of the already downloaded files. Now press "([b]Ctrl[/b]) + ([b]S[/b])" to start the torrent.

fields.title: How to install and use ZNC
fields.body:
[i][url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php]Wiki Home[/url][/i]

On Debian linux you can 'apt-get install znc' but this is an old version. This is how to install the latest ZNC from source.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What you will need:[/b][/size][/color]

[list]
[*]build-essential
[*]libssl-dev
[*]libperl-dev[/list]

To install these packages do

[pre]
sudo apt-get install build-essential libssl-dev libperl-dev
[/pre]
Now download the [url=https://znc.in/releases/]latest tarball[/url] (znc-0.200.tar.gz at time of writing) to a new folder and run the following commands: 

[pre]
tar -xzvf znc*.*gz
cd znc*
./configure
make
make install[/pre]
For more info about compiling see the [url=https://wiki.znc.in/Installation#Source_Tarball]ZNC wiki[/url]


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Configuring ZNC[/b][/size][/color]

Now run the initial configuration script with:

[pre]znc --makeconf[/pre]
This will ask you some questions and then create a config file at ~/.znc/configs/znc.conf
See the [url=https://wiki.znc.in/Configuration]ZNC wiki[/url] for more config options. However if you have enabled the web interface it is the best way to configure ZNC.

Once you have logged into the web admin you will want to create a user to connect to the tehconnection irc server. Click add user and fill in the following fields:

[list]
[*]Username - This is used to log into ZNC
[*]Password - To log into ZNC
[*]Allowed IPs - If you want to restrict access
[*]Nickname - This is your IRC nickname
[*]Alt. Nickname - In case that nick is unavailable
[*]BindHost - If your machine has multiple IP addresses choose which address to bind to
[*]Servers - Put "irc.tehconnection.eu +7000" for SSL otherwise "irc.tehconnection.eu 6667"
[*]Modules - I suggest you tick the Nickserv and Perform modules
[/list]


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Using ZNC[/b][/size][/color]

Once you have created a user you need to log into ZNC. In mIRC add a new server using the address you told ZNC to listen on and the port you specified. Dont forget to add a + before the port if your using SSL. Then in the password field put your username then a colon then your pass. So for example if your username was b3n and the pass was h8e2h8 then you would put b3n:h8e2h8 as the server password.

Once you have connected to see the list of available commands msg the znc user with:

[pre]/msg *znc help[/pre]
All commands are sent to the user *znc and each extra module has its own user. I suggest you setup the Nickserv and Perform modules with the following commands:

[pre]
/msg *perform add msg zooey auth [tehconnection username] [IRCkey]
/msg *nickserv set [Nickserv password]
[/pre]
Now you can connect your ZNC bouncer to tehconnection irc with:

[pre]/msg *znc connect[/pre]
ZNC has a lot more options and many different modules. You can find out more at the [url=https://wiki.znc.in/ZNC]ZNC wiki[/url].

fields.title: High 10 Profile (Hi10P/10 bit) Encodes
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What Are 10-Bit Encodes?[/b][/size][/color]


10 bit encodes utilise a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H.264/MPEG-4_AVC#Profiles]profile of the H.264 specification[/url] (Hi10P) which makes use of [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_depth]ten bits of information[/url] to [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/YUV]represent colour[/url]. This allows for a reduction of [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colour_banding]colour banding[/url] and an overall reduction in file size due to increased compression efficiency.

Ten bit encodes are automatically detected by TehConnection's MediaInfo parser and have a red denotation beside them:
[br /]
[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/EQSln.png[/img][/center]

The main drawback to this format is that not everything that is able to play Matroska files can play these... yet. An excellent playback tutorial including a section on ten bit playback is available (Windows only) [url=https://tehconnection.eu/forums.php?action=viewthread&threadid=3266]here[/url]. This article will remain as updated as possible and thus far the following list will detail which software/hardware can and cannot decode 10 bit files. For more information on ten bit colour, read on.

Software able to handle Hi10P:
[list=circle]
[*]MPC-HC & madVR ([url=https://tehconnection.eu/forums.php?action=viewthread&threadid=3266]guide[/url])
[*][url=https://mplayer2.srsfckn.biz/]mplayer2[/url] or [url=https://smplayer.srsfckn.biz/]smplayer[/url] (GUI)
[*][url=https://corecodec.com/products/coreavc]CoreAVC[/url] (revision 3.0+)
[*][url=https://nightlies.videolan.org/build/win32/last/]VLC[/url]
[/list]

Software Unable to Handle Hi10P:
[list=circle]
[*]DXVA
[*]CUDA
[/list]


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Tell Me More About Ten Bit Colour[/b][/size][/color]

Firstly, it is necessary for you to understand what [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_depth]bit depth[/url] is in the first place. The Wikipedia article is an excellent in-depth article but the key item to take away is that bit depth is the measure of accuracy available for storing and displaying colour.

At the consumer level, the majority of digital media (including Blu-ray) and hardware today and for the foreseeable future will have the ability to display eight bits of colour information. This is because eight bits has been the de facto standard for a very long time. Eight bits of colour means that for each of the three primary colours (red, green & blue) there are two hundred fifty six (256) different shades of that colour. Combined they allow for twenty four (24) bits of colour depth to be displayed which is also the most common colour depth configuration of most operating systems.

The total possible number of colours able to be displayed with eight bit systems is 16,777,216 (256[sup]3[/sup]). A ten bit colour depth allows for one thousand twenty four (1024) shades for each primary colour and over a billion total possible shades; twelve bit has four thousand ninety six shades for each primary colour and over sixty eight billion possible colours, 1024[sup]3[/sup] and 4096[sup]3[/sup] respectively.

To give you some context, your average cinema will use (at least) a 2K but usually a 4K projector and show film with a twelve bit (ten bit for 3D) colour depth.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Why Do We Need 10 Bit Encodes?[/b][/size][/color]

You might ask that if all of our hardware and digital media is stored and transmitted with an eight bit colour depth, aren't we wasting our time encoding with a ten bit colour depth? This is a good question and something that currently has many incorrect or partially correct answers.

To answer this we need a little side information, most LCD panels ([url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TFT_LCD#Twisted_nematic_.28TN.29]TN panels[/url] to be precise) can only represent a colour depth of six bits (a mere sixty four shades for each primary colour) and under normal circumstances to the regular user this would look terrible. To work around this issue these panels use a trick named '[url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dither]dithering[/url]' to simulate a colour depth of eight bits. In simplified terms this means that the panel quickly alternates between the nearest of the available sixty four (six bit) shades to simulate more available colour depth. When done correctly, a six bit panel is able to create the illusion that it is capable of a higher colour depth than it actually is.

This trick can also be used to display high bit depth encodes on hardware and software only capable of eight bit output.

This still does not fully answer the original question, surely we could simply encode in eight bit and hard code that dithering to simulate a ten bit colour depth?

This is actually already the case, it is mainly used to prevent [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colour_banding]colour banding[/url]. The huge drawback with this hard coding is that the bit rate required to keep the dithering intact is disproportionately high and can result in much larger files.

This is where the true advantage of ten bit encoding reveals itself; we are able to use fewer bits to represent the same image even if the source is only eight bits. We end up with a double whammy with ten bit encoding, not only do we no longer need to hard code dithering but we can also increase our error tolerance. Losing one bit of information in an eight bit colour range is equivalent to three bits in a ten bit space. This means that the same quality can be perceived with a lower bit rate allowing encoders to achieve [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transparency_(data_compression)]transparency[/url] with smaller files.

fields.title: Burn DVDR to DVD With ImgBurn (Windows)
fields.body:
[url=https://www.imgburn.com/]ImgBurn[/url] is the best application for burning DVDs on Windows. It also happens to be free. Here is a step by step guide to burn DVDR files you download from here to blank DVDs.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Burning An Image File (.iso, .img, .bin, .nrg)[/b][/size][/color]
[br /]
[list=circle]
[*]Open ImgBurn and select "Write image file to disc"
[img]https://i.imgur.com/TO6SF.png[/img]
[br /]
[*]Select your image file by clicking the small folder icon and then OK once you have selected it.
[img]https://i.imgur.com/anuZt.png[/img]
[br /]
[*]Once you have selected your file and have a blank disc present in your drive, you will be able to click the large "Write" button.
[/list]


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Burning A VIDEO_TS Folder[/b][/size][/color]
[br /]
[list=circle]
[*]Open ImgBurn and select the "Write files/folders to disc" option.
[img]https://i.imgur.com/RPiQ6.png[/img]
[br /]
[*]Click the small folder icon to browse for your VIDEO_TS folder and click OK when you have it. If you want you can click the calculator icon to have ImgBurn discover how large the DVD image is and make sure that you have the right sized DVD.
[img]https://i.imgur.com/dQ0zn.png[/img]
[br /]
[*]Click the large "Write" button once you have inserted your blank disc to begin the burning process.

fields.title: Top Ten
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What is this Top 10 I Keep Hearing About?[/b][/size][/color]

The [url=https://tehconnection.eu/top10.php]Top 10[/url] is a nifty site feature that tracks the top ten (and more once you gain access to the [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=140]advanced top ten[/url]) of a number of site variables.

The top ten is available to the Member class and above. More information on member classes is [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=2]here[/url].

The top ten variables tracked are divided into four sub-categories. Data tracked includes:

Torrents
[list=circle]
[*]Active Torrents (Day, Week, All Time)
[*]Snatched
[*]Data Transferred
[*]Seeded
[/list]

Users
[list=circle]
[*]Uploaders
[*]Downloaders
[*]Torrents Uploaded
[*]Fastest Uploaders
[*]Fastest Downloaders
[/list]

Forums
[list=circle]
[*]Forum Posters
[*]Fastest Posters
[*]Active Topics (Day, Week, All Time)
[/list]

Loved
[list=circle]
[*]Most Loved
[*]Category (Action, Comedy, Documentary, Drama, Musical, Thriller)
[/list]

fields.title: Advanced Top Ten
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]What is the Advanced Top Ten?[/b][/size][/color]

The Advanced Top Ten is a perk for members who reach the Teh Actor class and above. In addition to all of the features of the [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=139]top ten[/url], the advanced top ten provides extended tracking of most site variables. The Torrents, Users and Forums categories will also show the top one hundred ([b]100[/b]) and top two hundred fifty ([b]250[/b]) of each variable.

The Loved category has deliberately been kept at ten to avoid a large amount of pollution of the heart system.
