fields.title: How do you get a torrent to seed on transmission?
fields.body:
Hey! 

I am new to this site, which is amazing btw! Thank you for creating this!

So I am using transmission to download my torrents in and I am not sure how to get them to seed once they are downloaded. Before i joined Teh, the program I was using would automatically seed the torrents once they were finished but for some reason after they are finished downloading I get an exclamation mark next to the torrent and I am not able to get it to do anything. I am worried about ruining my ratio so if anyone can help me I would very much appreciate it! 

Also, the first two movies I downloaded were very fast and now for some reason it is taking days to download movies. Not sure what is going on, would love input of that issue as well!

Thank you!

fields.title: firztspawn - thoughts for TC
fields.body:
Things I would like to see implemented; either currently or in Black Swan (or any resurrection thereafter):

[size=5] DoT's / Staff:[/size][list]
[*] DoT's would benefit from the use of templates when pm-ing an uploader about an upload that is missing required info. There should be the ability to select from dropdows to choose the desired templated. The template would also be pre-filled in with the name of the torrent and the perma-link
[*] Staff need to be seen to be more active  - whether its in IRC or the forums. IMHO if the staff are seen to do nothing; the site will do nothing.
[*] Active participation by staff towards the encoder community within TC. Maybe promote TCO/HaB uploads every now and then on the front page
[*] More front page usage/communication. i.e. once every 2 to 3 weeks. Be it rule changes, promoting TCO's
[*] Maybe more community participation when looking at rule changes and clarity????? Not sure this is a good idea though.. but it will do something towards making staff appear more active and promoting more user/community participation. Or do something like this...[/list]

[size=5] Uploader's / Archivist's:[/size][list][*] Upload templates - depending on your selection under "Format" would depend on the template bought up for the user to fill in
[*] Archivists like gfadhriu should have auto access to #tc.uploaders IRC. It would benefit them as well as the site to know whats going to be [or is available to be] uploaded
[*] In #tc.uploaders there needs to be a bot with the ability to scrape sites like SCC, HDBits, AwesomeHD etc. and then announce the movie uploads [b]ONLY[/b]
[*] Archivists who have usenet etc. access should be actively sought after. These are the guys who will benefit the site greatly in regards to torrent retention. Somehow staff need to actively promote archiving to get more people in that userclass
[*] Perks need to be sorted out for the new userclasses - Uploader and Archivist. Something like the ability to edit their own CT's; discounted SeedVPS seedboxes, the ability to customise their userclass, half-leech on any torrent on site (Archivist only) or limited number of half-leech per month, no taxes on requests. Some of these may already be available.. would have to check[/list]



[*] Site should be able to grab full synopsis from imdb, not the partial it does now (ala MacGuffin).
e.g. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2845578/
Currently the site will only grab:
"A war photographer who recently endured a brutal detainment in Libya holes up in Sicily to come to terms with her ordeal, not far from the home of her former lover and mentor. Soon she ...". It should be able to search imdb for the full synopsis
[*] 
[*] 
[*] 
[*] 
[*]

fields.title: autodl-community
fields.body:
[url=https://sourceforge.net/projects/autodl-irssi/]autodl-irssi[/url] is a great torrent auto-downloader. But its development has stopped, and the support forums have been closed for some time. autodl-community is a fork of autodl-irssi that strives to keep up with the needs of the bittorrent community.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Code[/b][/size][/color]

There is a [url=https://github.com/autodl-community/autodl-irssi]repository[/url] on Github for easy viewing, sharing, and contributing. It already contains a [url=https://github.com/autodl-community/autodl-irssi/compare/community-v1.32...master]long list[/url] of changes made from the official version. We have added the [url=https://github.com/autodl-community/autodl-rutorrent]ruTorrent plugin[/url] to match our additions. Report bugs and make requests on our [url=https://github.com/autodl-community/autodl-irssi/issues]issue tracker[/url] or [url=https://help.github.com/articles/fork-a-repo]fork us[/url] if you have something to contribute.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]IRC[/b][/size][/color]

Along with keeping the code up-to-date, we feel it's important to have a place for users to come for help with filters, general usage, or just chat. We have created an IRC channel for that purpose. You can find us at [b]#autodl-community[/b] on [b]irc.p2p-network.net[/b]. Even if you just feel like idling, please stop by.


[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Contact Us[/b][/size][/color]

Github: [b][url=https://github.com/autodl-community]https://github.com/autodl-community[/url][/b]
e-mail: [b]autodl.community@gmail.com[/b]
IRC: [b]#autodl-community[/b] on [b]irc.p2p-network.net[/b]
Latest Version: [b][url=https://autodl-irssi-community.googlecode.com/files/autodl-irssi-community.zip]https://autodl-irssi-community.googlecode.com/files/autodl-irssi-community.zip[/url][/b]
[url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=219]TC Howto[/url]


The project members have limited time and aren't members of every tracker, so please direct all concerns to IRC, e-mail, or GitHub rather than asking questions on the tracker. If you'd like to spread this post to a tracker you belong to, please contact us by e-mail.

fields.title: Bittorrent Phonebook
fields.body:
You might have found yourself disabled at another private tracker for one reason or another or perhaps their site is down and you'd like to know more. This is a table inspired by a post by WormsWitchity at What.CD which lists all tracker IRC support and chat channels. Sites are listed alphabetically but there are quite a number so Ctrl + F if you're looking for something specific. Both full site name and initialism (where available) are listed.

fields.title: Installing ffmpeg on linux
fields.body:
[color=#4682b4][size=5][b]Installing ffmpeg[/b][/size][/color]

We recommend always using the latest available build for FFmpeg to generate screenshots, as this will ensure the best possibile compatibility with the latest encoding standards and result in the most accurate screenshots.

[indent][i][size=3]
You have three options. Install from a repository, install from a static binary or compile ffmpeg yourself. Installing from a repository will often result in you having a pretty old version of ffmpeg and so isn't recommended. Compiling ffmpeg yourself is slightly involved but if you want to there is [url=https://trac.ffmpeg.org/wiki/UbuntuCompilationGuide]a guide for debian based distrobutions here[/url][/size][/i][/indent]

This guide will walk you through installing ffmpeg from a static binary someone else has compiled:

Go to https://ffmpeg.gusari.org/static/

Choose 32bit or 64bit depending on your system.
Copy the URL of the latest build.
Run the following but with your up to date url and file name:
[list]
[*]wget https://ffmpeg.gusari.org/static/32bit/ffmpeg.static.32bit.2013-10-01.tar.gz
[*]tar -zxvf ffmpeg.static.32bit.2013-10-01.tar.gz
[/list]

Put the binary somewhere smart. This will probably be in the /usr/bin/ directory, although we recommend putting it in  /home/<username>/bin and adding that directory to your [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PATH_(variable)]$PATH[/url]. The reason for this is so you don't have to specify the path to the binary every time you want to use it. This is fine if you only use FFmpeg with this script, but is a bother if you use FFmpeg for anything else. Example: 
[list]
[*]sudo mv ffmpeg /usr/bin
[/list]

You should now have ffmpeg installed.

Test the whole setup: "ffmpeg --help". This should give you a basic help output. If you get "could not execute binary file", you probably have the wrong architecture for your system. If you get "no ffmpeg in <blah>" or "ffmpeg: command not found", then you haven't moved ffmpeg somewhere within your $PATH.

[i](info provided by elwood & AmorphousDeception)[/i]

fields.title: Templates for messaging uploaders regards missing info
fields.body:
I know as a DoT that you can spend quite a bit of time messaging uploaders about missing mediainfo/sceens/bdinfo/etc.

With that in mind, I decided to create templates to basically cover most common scenarios.

They are:

[quote=Missing screens and bdinfo]

Hello,

torrent: <insert url here>

1. Your upload is missing screenshots as per the site upload requirements.

A guide on how to obtain screenshots and add them to your upload; can be found here: https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=98
Please remember that any screens should be in .png format, as this is a lossless format and gives a better idea of quality.

2. When uploading Blu-ray source, you need to provide bdinfo; not mediainfo. Please read the section "Untouched Blu-ray Description" in this guide: https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=98
It will guide you with what you need to do for this upload.

If you require any help with any of this, please ask me so I can assist you.

Thank you :)[/quote]


[quote=Missing bdinfo]
Hello,

torrent: 

When uploading Blu-ray source, you need to provide bdinfo; not mediainfo. Please read the section "Untouched Blu-ray Description" in this guide: https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=98
It will guide you with what you need to do for this upload.

If you require any help with any of this, please ask me so I can assist you.

Thank you :)[/quote]


[quote=Missing DVD info and screens]
Hello,

torrent: 

Can you please fill in the site provided template. With DVDR uploads, we require different information as many DVDR uploads can be from different regions, come with different extras, etc. etc.

Also, your upload is missing screenshots as per the site upload requirements.

A guide on how to obtain screenshots and add them to your upload; can be found here: https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=98
Please remember that any screens should be in .png format, as this is a lossless format and gives a better idea of quality.

If you require any help with this, please ask.

Thank you :)[/quote]


[quote=Missing DVD Info]
Hello,

torrent: 

Can you please fill in the site provided template. With DVDR uploads, we require different information as many DVDR uploads can be from different regions, come with different extras, etc. etc.

If you require any help with this, please ask.

Thank you :)[/quote]


[quote=Missing mediainfo]
Hello,

Torrent: 

Your upload is missing mediainfo as per the site upload requirements.

A guide on how to obtain medianfo, and add it to your upload; can be found here: https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=98

If you require any help, please do not hesitate to ask. If you are in IRC, you can pm me there as well.

Thank you :)[/quote]


[quote=Screens - jpeg, wrong resolution, one or two missing]
Hello,

torrent: 

One or more of your screens contravenes the following rule:

[quote=Site Rules]At least three lossless [.png] screenshots of the film (not of blank frames, titles, credits or logos) are required for all uploads.[/quote]

If you need help with this or further clarification; please ask

Thank you :)[/quote]


[quote=Missing screens and mediainfo]
Hello,

Torrent: 

Your upload is missing screenshots and mediainfo, as per the site upload requirements.

A guide on how to obtain these requirements, and add them to your upload; can be found here: https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=98
Please remember that any screens should be in .png format, as this is a lossless format and gives a better idea of quality.

If you require any help, please do not hesitate to ask. If you are in IRC, you can pm me there as well.

I would also suggest you re-read the [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=88]Site Rules[/url] please; especially the "Uploading" section

Thank you :)[/quote]


[quote=No screens]
Hello,

Torrent: 

Your upload is missing screenshots as per the site upload requirements.

A guide on how to obtain screenshots and add them to your upload; can be found here: https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=98
Please remember that any screens should be in .png format, as this is a lossless format and gives a better idea of quality.

If you require any help, please do not hesitate to ask. If you are in IRC, you can pm me there as well.

Thank you :)[/quote]

[quote="Screenshots"]
Torrent:
Torrent: 

I know you are new here so here is some info on screenshots when uploading that you need to be aware of:

[list]
[*]Must provide three or more screenshots.
[*]Screenshots must be in .png format (the thumbnail can be in .jpeg but the original image hosted must be .png)
[*]High definition screenshots may NOT be hosted on imgur (compresses the file size, loss of quality)
[/list]


For image hosts we prefer https://www.imagebam.com/ | https://imgbox.com/

In regards to choosing a thumbnail size be sure to select something of appropriate size. On sites like imgbox and imagebam the default is 100x100 which is far too small. Below are some examples of sizes you should choose depending on the type of screens you're uploading.

350 x 350 Keep aspect ratio -- this setting is good for solo screens
250 x 250 Keep aspect ratio -- this setting is ideal for source vs. encode screens; where you want the screens to appear side by side
150 x 150 Keep aspect ratio -- this setting is ideal for when you are comparing source vs. encode1 vs. encode2; where you want 3 screens to appear side by side

So with that in mind, please fix the torrents mentioned above.

If you have any questions or need any help, please ask.

Thank you :)
[/quote]

I would suggest that if you decide to use these, personalise them a bit, maybe also change them slightly every so soften.

Hopefully v3. will have similar templates added :)

[b]One for the moderators:[/b]


[quote=Reported torrent]
Hi,

we have had a report on a torrent you are seeding:

torrent: [i]permalink here[/i]

This has been reported for "[i]report reason[/i]"

Have you watched this movie? If so, can you please confirm if this report is correct or not?

If you have not watched the movie yet, please disregard this pm as this is a voluntary request.

Thank you :)
[/quote]

fields.title: Generating scene samples using srrdb (Linux)
fields.body:
Here on tehconnection your uploads can be trumped if they are missing the nfo or sample files. Lots of sites end up only with the main file. Here is a guide that will let you replace those missing files if it is in the database here: https://www.srrdb.com/

[color=#4682b4][size=5]Instructions for linux:[/size][/color]

[color=#4682b4][size=4]Get it:[/size][/color]

Download [url=https://rescene.wikidot.com/downloads#pyrescene]pyrescene[/url] for example:

[pre]wget https://rescene.wdfiles.com/local--files/downloads/pyReScene-0.5.1.zip[/pre]


[color=#4682b4][size=4]Install it[/size][/color]

[pre]unzip pyReScene-0.5.1.zip
cd pyReScene-0.5.1
sudo python setup.py build
sudo python setup.py install
[/pre]


[color=#4682b4][size=4]Set up[/size][/color]

Move your movie file into a folder with the right name. For example I had Groundhog.Day.1993.1080p.BluRay.x264-CiNEFiLE.mkv and it was in the database [url=https://www.srrdb.com/release/details/Groundhog.Day.1993.PROPER.1080p.BluRay.x264-CiNEFiLE]here[/url] so I ran:

[code]mkdir Groundhog.Day.1993.PROPER.1080p.BluRay.x264-CiNEFiLE
mv Groundhog.Day.1993.1080p.BluRay.x264-CiNEFiLE.mkv Groundhog.Day.1993.PROPER.1080p.BluRay.x264-CiNEFiLE
curl https://www.srrdb.com/download/srr/Groundhog.Day.1993.PROPER.1080p.BluRay.x264-CiNEFiLE >> out.srr
srr out.srr
[/code]

Then cancel the process before it makes all the rar files unless you need them (ctrl-C).


[color=#4682b4][size=4]Make the sample and clean up[/size][/color]

[pre]srs groundhog.day.1993.1080p.bluray.x264.sample-cinefile.srs Groundhog.Day.1993.1080p.BluRay.x264-CiNEFiLE.mkv
rm *.sfv *.rar *.svf *.srs *.srr
[/pre]


Then you should have a full scene release as required.

[i]Info provided by elwood[/i]

fields.title: Hints, Tips, etc. for RSS Notifications
fields.body:
[b]Hints, Tips, & a quick guide on RSS Notifications[/b]

Individual notifications are a perk for members who reach Fanatic class. You can find more information on the userclasses [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=2]here[/url].

A few things to note about RSS feeds here at TehConnection:[list]
[*] The following are not announced on RSS: Freeleech, Movie of the Week (MOTW).
[*] Google Reader does not support http authentication, so will not work with RSS [i]- still to be confirmed[/i][/list]


Setting up RSS Notifications is easy, but varies depending on the browser you use.


[b]Firefox[/b]:

Click on "Bookmarks", then look for the RSS icon [img]https://i57.tinypic.com/345ivqh.jpg[/img]
Then select the feed you want: [img]https://i45.tinypic.com/33z3aja.png[/img]

Firefox users can also use an extension called [url=https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/downloads/file/223691/sage-1.5.2-fx.xpi?src=version-history]Sage 1.5.2[/url]
When using Sage, navigate to the Home Page where Sage will find a feed that's a direct download. When you click on a movie within the feed, a windows opens asking what you want to do with the torrent file
[img]https://i42.tinypic.com/okby9s.png[/img]


[b]Chrome[/b]:

Chrome users will need to add this extension:[url=https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/rss-subscription-extensio/nlbjncdgjeocebhnmkbbbdekmmmcbfjd]RSS Subscription Extension[/url].
Install it, then navigate to "Torrents" page then click on the RSS icon [img]https://i57.tinypic.com/345ivqh.jpg[/img] in the address bar

Incidentally, you may be wondering what P.T.N means. It simply means Personalized Torrent Notifications. You can create one by clicking on "Notifications" (located between "Watch Queue" and "Posts" on the User Information Bar


If for some reason, your RSS feed is not working, you can check your personal information by doing the folllowing:

Navigate to https://tehconnection.eu/index.php
Right click anywhere on the page -> "View Page Source"
Look/Search (Control+F is easiest) for <!-- Begin RSS Feeds -->
Beneath that, there will be a line that starts with "href"
From that line, note the following values: user, auth, passkey, authkey
Your correct RSS link should be:

h--p://tehconnection.eu/feeds.php?feed=torrents_all&user=ID&auth=AUTH&passkey=PASSKEY&authkey=AUTHKEY

replace ID, AUTH, PASSKEY, AUTHKEY with the values you noted from the Page Source.


[i]Credits (from various pages on TC): bolshoi, derekguy, poliopi, and others[/i]

fields.title: How to Generate Screenshots REMOTELY in ruTorrent
fields.body:
Hi there!


[b][u]HERE is the problem[/u]:[/b]
So, I have a SeedBox running ruTorrent v3.6 that is provisioned by WiCKED SERVICES...and I was attempting to generate some screenshots, BUT I ran into difficulties using their built-in screenshot option (which is provided by the Screenshots v3.60 plug-in).

When I attempted to create screenshots for a .mkv file (by right-clicking "Create -> Screenshots") VIA the "File Manager" tab:

In "Console" I would get...

Command log:

--
Video screenshots creation started. Please wait this could take some time


In my "Log" I get...

[02.08.2014 01:53:51] File Manager ERROR: undefined - 200 Current ffmpeg/ffprobe not supported. Please compile a newer version. SyntaxError: JSON.parse: unexpected character

...ALSO I later got a slightly different Syntax Error message:
[02.08.2014 14:02:25] File Manager ERROR: undefined - 200 Current ffmpeg/ffprobe not supported. Please compile a newer version. SyntaxError: Unexpected token C


(...AND no screenshots are produced.)


[b][u]HERE is my solution[/u]:[/b]
While I suspect that some of the above issues with accessing this function VIA the "File Manager" tab resulted from some issue with my particular SeedBox host's installed version of ruTorrent v3.6, their tech support in this matter left me searching for my own answers.  Here is what I found...

1) Instead of trying to access the "Create -> Screenshots" VIA the "File Manager" tab, FIRST select the completed torrent (in the MAIN ruTorrent window) and THEN access the "Create -> Screenshots" VIA the "Files" tab.

2) The Screenshots interface is quite limited.  If you wish to configure any of the settings, click the blue sprocket "Settings..." icon (toward the top of the window) in ruTorrent, THEN click the "Screenshots" tab on the left-hand side.


[b][u]Some additional resources[/u]:[/b]
Here are some useful links (from ANOTHER SeedBox provider) incase you get lost along the way...

https://wikidev.xirvik.com/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=tutorial_en_rutorrent#file_explorer_and_screenshot_plugin

https://wikidev.xirvik.com/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=tutorial_en_rutorrent#screenshot_settings


Hope that helps! ;)



-A.S.

fields.title: TCO HaB encode of the month - December
fields.body:
Well, it's almost that time if the year. So for this month, I have run with the Christmas/Family theme. And because I can, I have selected 2 encodes from the same movie group this month :D 

These were both HaB encodes submitted by our own imdb.

This month's featured encodes can be found in the following group:


[columns][center][size=6][url=https://jumpcut.to/something8916]Miracle on 34th Street (1947) - SD and 1080p - HaB[/url][/size]
[url=https://jumpcut.to/something8916][img]https://i.imgur.com/E8WwQ.jpg[/img][/url]
[b]Miracle on 34th Street (1947)[/b][/center]
[i]At the Macy's Department Store Thanksgiving Day parade, the actor playing Santa is discovered to be drunk by a whiskered old man. Doris Walker, the no nonsense special events director, persuades the old man to take his place. The old man proves to be a sensation and is quickly recruited to be the store Santa at the main Macy's outlet. While he is successful, Ms. Walker learns that he calls himself Kris Kringle and he claims to be the actual Santa Claus. Despite reassurances by Kringle's doctor that he is harmless, Doris still has misgivings, especially when she has cynically trained herself, and especially her daughter, Susan, to reject all notions of belief and fantasy. And yet, people, especially Susan, begin to notice there is something special about Kris and his determination to advance the true spirit of Christmas amidst the rampant commercialism around him and succeeding in improbable ways. When a raucous conflict with the store's cruelly incompetent psychologist erupts, Kris finds himself held at Bellevue where, in despair, he deliberates fails a mental examination to ensure his commitment. All seems lost until Doris' friend, Fred Gaily, reassure Kris of his worth and agrees to represent him in the fight to secure his release. To achieve that, Fred arranges a formal hearing in which he argues that Kris is sane because he is in fact Santa Claus. What ensues is a bizarre hearing in which people's beliefs are reexamined and put to the test, but even so, it's going to take a miracle for Kris to win.	[/i]
[/columns]


If you are interested in learning to encode, or you think you have encodes which you believe fit the criteria for TCO, check out the following threads:

[url=https://tehconnection.eu/forums.php?action=viewthread&threadid=5652]TC Original Encoding Support[/url]

[url=https://tehconnection.eu/forums.php?action=viewthread&threadid=619]DVD to x264 Guide (Windows[/url]
[url=https://tehconnection.eu/forums.php?action=viewthread&threadid=3251]HD to x264 Encoding Guide (Windows)[/url]

For further encoding help, we also have an [url=https://tehconnection.eu/forums.php?action=viewforum&forumid=33]encoder's support forum[/url], as well as an IRC channel: #tc.encoders on our [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=104]IRC network[/url].

Enjoy <3

fields.title: streisand
fields.body:
[size=5]Necessary for beta:[/size]
[list]
[*] Donations
[*] Films (w/ imdb info, genre tags, user favorites)
[*] Torrents (with comments, NFO, mediainfo, DoT checking, etc.)
[*] Torrent upload/download
[*] Mediainfo parser
[*] Torrent requests (w/ votes & comments)
[*] Reseed requests
[*] User profile pages (view/edit)
[*] Forums
[*] Wiki
[*] Search (films, forums, wiki, users, requests, log)
[*] Invites (send/view)
[*] Registration
[*] News
[*] Basic admin UI
[*] MOTW
[*] Issue tracker (reports, staff pms)
[*] Site log (try to parse them into more useful entries)
[*] Notifications (torrents, requests, forums, issues)
[*] Login rate-limiting
[*] Average seeding size calculations
[*] HNR system
[/list]

[size=5]Necessary for launch:[/size]
[list]
[*] IRC bot
[*] IRC access controls
[*] IP bans
[*] IP address history
[*] Email address history
[*] Announce key history
[*] Password change history
[/list]

[size=5]Later features:[/size]
[list]
[*] API
[*] RSS feeds
[*] Watch queue
[*] Film Lists (montages)
[*] People (from TMDB data)
[*] Reviews (from other sources)
[*] Daily tracker-wide stats (daily_stats table)
[*] Top 10 or similar
[*] User stats
[*] Custom style sheets
[*] Invite tree view
[*] Inbox
[*] Polls
[*] Watched Users
[/list]

[size=5]Removed features:[/size]
[list]
[*] Bookmarks
[*] Friends
[*] What.CD soundtrack links
[/list]

fields.title: autodl-irrsi Guide for rutorrent
fields.body:
[center][u][b]Setting up IRC for autodl-irssi[/b][/u][/center]

[list] 
[*]Use the “Edit” link next to your site name to access your settings
[*]Enter an IRCKey to use for access to TC’s invite-only IRC channels
[*]Check the box for #tehconnection to receive announces of new uploads through the main channel
[*]Check the box for #tc.motw if you would like to receive announces for the upcoming Movies of the Week
[i][color=red]Possibly obsolete step - still to confirm[/color][/i]
[*]If you need help connecting to IRC see this wiki:  [url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=104]IRC Network Information[/url][/list]

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/XGhEZJr.png[/img][/center] 
[br]
[center][u][b]Configuring autodl-irssi - ruTorrent plugin[/b] [/u][/center]
[list]
[*]Begin by opening the auto-dl menu in ruTorrent, and selecting "Trackers"
[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/FzTM9mS.png[/img][/center]

[*]Copy a download link from any torrent on TehConnection, and paste the link in one of the two text boxes. ruTorrent will parse your keys
[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/BGqbDau.png[/img]
[/center]
[*]Select “IRC Servers” from the drop down box and fill with the following information:

[u]IRC Server[/u]
Server: irc.tehconnection.eu
Port: 6667
Nick: SiteNick|bot or SiteNick|autodl (your site nick must be at the beginning of the IRC nick to authenticate successfully)
Password: IRCKey

*Note: If you receive the following error: ERROR: Got HTTP 301, Check your cookie settings! Please check or uncheck the option Force HTTPS (SSL) downloads and make sure authkey and torrent pass are correct.

[u]IRC Channel[/u]
Channel: #tehconnection (in addition to our main channel, this is also our announce chan)
Nick= site nick
Password= IRCkey (not site pass) This can be set in your profile settings
Invite command: /msg Zooey auth username IRCKey (actually type in username and IRC key)

[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/cEnCOeS.png[/img][/center]

[*]You should be connected to IRC after saving these settings
[*]Open “Filters” from the drop down menu. You can use filters to heavily customize your auto-downloading. 
[*]On the first page, select TehConnection.eu from the “Match Sites” dropdown menu, or type the in the text box

[u]The other valid fields for TC releases include:[/u]

[*]Match/except releases
[*]Minimum/Maximum size
[*]Movie title
[*]Resolutions (drop down menu)
[*]Encoders (drop down menu)
[*]Sources (drop down menu)
[*]Year
[*]Scene (under “Music” tab)
[br]
[center][img]https://i.imgur.com/bbqxmjN.png[/img]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/LJeZ3Xt.png[/img][/center] 
[br]

If you received an error:
ERROR: Got HTTP 301, Check your cookie settings! (Then it shows the name of the torrent & Tracker)

Check or uncheck Force HTTPS (SSL) downloads and make sure authkey and torrent pass are correct. The TC announces are with HTTPS urls.
	
[size=4][i]If you are still having trouble, please join #TC.Support and we will do our best to guide you through the process.[/i][/list][/size]

fields.title: MOTW Template
fields.body:
[pre]Post your vote here for MotW Sunday DAY[sup]th[/sup] MONTH. Voting ends in 7 days.

[br][br][align=center][color=#4F2A64][size=6]The current nominees eligible for voting are:[/size][/color][/align]

[url=][/url] [color=#2262FF][/color]
[url=][/url] [color=#2262FF][/color]
[url=][/url] [color=#2262FF][/color]
[url=][/url] [color=#2262FF][/color]
[url=][/url] [color=#2262FF][/color]
[url=][/url] [color=#2262FF][/color]
[url=][/url] [color=#2262FF][/color]
[url=][/url] [color=#2262FF][/color]
[url=][/url] [color=#2262FF][/color]
[url=][/url] [color=#2262FF][/color]

Only one post per user per week.

If you change your mind, edit the post.

If you wish to discuss MotW with other members of 'The TC Academy' please join the dedicated #tc.motw channel in IRC or use the [url=https://tehconnection.eu/forums.php?action=viewthread&threadid=5121]discussion thread[/url].

The MotW is now decided one week ahead of time, but we ask that you not "spoil" the upcoming films for members who can't access this forum (e.g. by posting MotW comments on the film group page, before the film is officially MotW).

[color=#2262FF]Total Votes Cast:[/color] [b][/b]
[color=#00FFD4]Winner: [/color] [b][/b]

[color=red]For those new to motw voting and as a reminder to old hands DO NOT reveal information in these threads in any forums, film comments or irc (excepting #tc.motw) The results of MOTW should be a surprise for all user classes below Director. Those found to be in breach of this will be appropriately dealt with.[/color][/pre]

fields.title: How to create a SOURCE vs. SOURCE comparison set from caps-a-holic.com
fields.body:
So, for now, this is just a "quick-n-dirty" little step-by-step Wiki (which I, or someone else MAY better illustrate at a later date)...

1)  Find your desired movie title on [b][url=https://caps-a-holic.com]caps-a-holic.com[/url][/b] and choose two of the available sets of SOURCE screenshots.

2)  Click the "PNG" button (top/middle area above the medium sized "Preview" screenshot) and THEN click "Fullscreen Comparison" (top/right).

3)  Scroll down below the "Preview" screenshot until you come to your PNG formatted "Fullscreen" screenshot.  Prior to mouse-over one of your two selected sources will load, right-click the image and you should see an option to save the image.

4)  Click the "PNG" button (top/middle area above the medium sized "Preview" screenshot) and THEN click "Fullscreen Comparison" (top/right).

5)  Scroll down below the "Preview" screenshot until you come to your PNG formatted "Fullscreen" screenshot (prior to mouse-over one of your two selected sources will load, the other source will load when you mouse over).  Right-click the image and you should (hopefully) see an option in your browser to save the image locally to your HD.

6)  Click the NEXT numbered comparison frame (just above the "Preview" screenshot) and repeat steps 2-5 (above).

7)  Once you have saved ALL of your desired PNG formatted "Fullscreen" screenshots locally on your HD for one set of sources (I would recommend the use of simple/strategic filenames for organization), THEN go back and reverse the two previously selected sources (in step 1) so that the other source will load on mouseover (in step 5).

8)  Double check that everything appears to be in good working order, THEN upload to your SOURCE vs. SOURCE comparison set to your preferred screenshot host (for a touch of class, I would suggest "citing" your source as being caps-a-holic.com in your screenshots description).

9)  Use the "Screenshots" section of our [b][url=https://tehconnection.eu/wiki.php?action=article&id=98]Release Description Guide[/url][/b] to properly format and label your SOURCE vs. SOURCE tags.

All the best! ;)


-A.S.

p.s.  Here's a good/solid example of how this could and should look in it's final form, here on TC...
https://jumpcut.to/something320&torrentid=29248
